1:
Wisdom builds her own house, just like a woman who has built her home, 
\q2 and she made seven pillars that she used to support the roof of her house. 
\q1
2:
She prepared a meal and set her table;
\q1 she prepared the animals and cooked them to serve for the dinner, 
\q1 and she made the wine ready for her guests.
\q1
3:
Like a woman who sends out her maids to give the invitations to her guests, Wisdom calls out from the highest place in the city for all to hear, and she says:
\q1
4:
"If you have not been instructed, come here!"
\q1 and she gives the invitation to come to those who have no good judgment.
\q1
5:
"Come and eat the food that I have prepared," she says, 
\q2 "and drink the good wine that I have mixed.
\q1
6:
Leave your untrained ways behind you, and live, 
\q2 and I will show you how to walk on the road that will give you understanding.
\b
\q1
7:
If you rebuke someone who says insulting things about other people, he will insult you, too.
\q1 If you offer correction to an evil person, he will hurt you.
\q1
8:
A person who insults others will hate you if you tell him to stop. 
\q2 But if you rebuke a wise person, he will become your friend.
\q1
9:
If you give instruction to a wise person, he will become even more wise.
\q2 And if you teach a person who does what is right, he will learn even more.
\b
\q1
10:
The first step in getting wisdom is to give Yahweh the respect he deserves, 
\q2 and knowing Yahweh, the Holy One, is the where understanding comes from. 
\q1
11:
If you become wise, your days will be filled full, 
\q2 and you will add years to your life. 
\q1
12:
If you get wisdom, you will gain many benefits from it;
\q2 but when you ridicule other people, you will suffer by yourself."
\b
\q1
14:
She sits at the door of her house
\q2 or on the highest place in the town,
\q1
15:
and she calls out to the men who are passing by,
\q2 to those walking down the road, concerned only about where they are going.
\q1
16:
"Any of you who have no experience, come here,"
\q2 she says to those who have no good judgment.
\q1
17:
"Water that you have stolen is sweet,
\q2 and food that you eat by yourself is delicious,
\q1
18:
The man does not know that the dead are in her home;
\q2 that those who went in to her are now in the grave."
